none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on May 10, 2015 Description from Terminal Escape:
If you thought I was going to start back up with some crucial piece of Asian hardcore history that I unearthed on my recent journey, then I'm sorry to disappoint you. Unfortunately I wasn't able to hit Flower Records in Nakano (a hotbed of weird demos, I snagged the SEX one song banger there in '09), I passed on the handful of rare Japanese tapes I came across (wisely deciding that my Yen would be better spent on records), and cassette culture was a thing of the past before punk culture took hold China or South Korea. I did scoop a couple of Mongolian tapes that will intrigue the open minded and bum out punk purists, but those are for another day. Today you get noisy, raw, disjointed and irreverent Brasilian hardcore dished out by a crew of teenage punks and weirdos in the late '90s. The attitude here can be found in a lot of current Midwest HC rehash, the 6th unnamed track in particular would sit quite nicely amongst the pile of gold currently plopping out of Northwest Indiana's backside. Sharp, smart, and unabashedly filthy hardcore punk. Welcome back. PLUTO!
//1.bp.blogspot.com/-e8fOzdl1des/VU-S1q7tv9I/AAAAAAAAMLY/GLudDIwRYmY/s1600/pluto%2Bcover%2Bcopy.jpg //3.bp.blogspot.com/-zyFBsVg6O2o/VU-U5mQ4JKI/AAAAAAAAMLk/k-QAPnsNS4s/s1600/pluto%2Bimg%2Bcopy.jpg //4.bp.blogspot.com/-M0E3vmVwJT0/VU-VANxerfI/AAAAAAAAMLs/AcRYI2vx_3A/s1600/pluto%2Bback%2Bcopy.jpg

seo.title: Pluto. - Rehearsal demo 199? - Terminal Escape
